name: disputatious
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
liking to argue and disagree, or arguing and disagreeing a lot: Disputatious and difficult, he was not much missed when he resigned his post. The disputatious style of his magazine articles led him into controversy. See
dispute
More examplesFewer examplesWe could be a very quarrelsome, disputatious family, but we stuck together. This is not the place to embark on a disputatious wrangle leading nowhere.Lawyers are disputatious by inclination.He liked to call them in for disputatious council meetings.I've always been disputatious. I love to debate and to pursue an argument.
